{{cpp/container/span/title|back}}
{{cpp/container/span/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|
constexpr reference back() const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns a reference to the last element in the span.

Calling {{tt|back}} on an empty span results in undefined behavior.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
A reference to the back element.

===Complexity===
Constant.

===Notes===
For a span {{tt|c}}, the expression {{c|c.back()}} is equivalent to {{c|*(c.end() - 1)}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;span&gt;

void print_forward(std::span&lt;const int&gt; const span)
{
    for (auto n{span.size()}; n != 0; --n)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; span.last(n).front() &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}

void print_backward(std::span&lt;const int&gt; const span)
{
    for (auto n{span.size()}; n != 0; --n)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; span.first(n).back() &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}

int main()
{
    constexpr int numbers[]{0, 1, 2, 3, 4};
    print_forward(numbers);
    print_backward(numbers);
}
|output=
0 1 2 3 4
4 3 2 1 0
}}
